intro: Linaria stenantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, branching stems and linear, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow with a distinctive bilabiate structure, resembling those of the common toadflax. Linaria stenantha thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
